issue.title: \Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash throw error on Sylius 1.12
issue.body:
**Sylius version affected**: 1.12.x

**Description**  
This trait is trowing error since the "session" service has been removed from Symfony.
It should be migrated to RequestStack->getSession().

**Steps to reproduce** 
Create a controller that use `\Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait` and call short method  `addFlash`

**Possible Solution**  
Posted above

comment.body:
> In that case, all you have to do is wait for a patch with this fix if you have time to wait, because it might not be soon.
That issue has been reported a year ago, fixed 2 month ago and still not merged yet :(
https://github.com/Sylius/SyliusResourceBundle/issues/535

```suggestion
    public function iShouldSeeAmountVariantsInTheList(int $amount): void
```

issue.title: \Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash throw error on Sylius 1.12
issue.body:
**Sylius version affected**: 1.12.x

**Description**  
This trait is trowing error since the "session" service has been removed from Symfony.
It should be migrated to RequestStack->getSession().

**Steps to reproduce** 
Create a controller that use `\Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait` and call short method  `addFlash`

**Possible Solution**  
Posted above

comment.body:
> You can use it right now, avoiding calling the short `Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash` method.

Which require me a major refactoring of my application since I rely on a broken internal method of Sylius.
I have to rewrite the trait since it is no longer compatible with the Symfony ControllerTrait::addFlash which is now completely typed, leading to a compilation error.

issue.title: \Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash throw error on Sylius 1.12
issue.body:
**Sylius version affected**: 1.12.x

**Description**  
This trait is trowing error since the "session" service has been removed from Symfony.
It should be migrated to RequestStack->getSession().

**Steps to reproduce** 
Create a controller that use `\Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait` and call short method  `addFlash`

**Possible Solution**  
Posted above

comment.body: You can use it right now, avoiding calling the short `Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash` method.

issue.title: \Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash throw error on Sylius 1.12
issue.body:
**Sylius version affected**: 1.12.x

**Description**  
This trait is trowing error since the "session" service has been removed from Symfony.
It should be migrated to RequestStack->getSession().

**Steps to reproduce** 
Create a controller that use `\Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait` and call short method  `addFlash`

**Possible Solution**  
Posted above

comment.body:
> If you only send flash messages in your project, you could send it directly through the Request object, for example like this: `$request->getSession()->getFlashBag()->add()`

That exactly what I've suggested in my first message 😆 

>  It should be migrated to RequestStack->getSession().

issue.title: \Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash throw error on Sylius 1.12
issue.body:
**Sylius version affected**: 1.12.x

**Description**  
This trait is trowing error since the "session" service has been removed from Symfony.
It should be migrated to RequestStack->getSession().

**Steps to reproduce** 
Create a controller that use `\Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait` and call short method  `addFlash`

**Possible Solution**  
Posted above

comment.body: If you only send flash messages in your project, you could send it directly through the Request object, for example like this: `$request->getSession()->getFlashBag()->add()`

#15464 - here is a PR with a new concept. Now there is a `Sylius\Behat\Service\Converter\IriConverterInterface` which extends `ApiPlatform\Api\IriConverterInterface` and adds a method 'getIriFromResourceInSection`.

issue.title: \Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash throw error on Sylius 1.12
issue.body:
**Sylius version affected**: 1.12.x

**Description**  
This trait is trowing error since the "session" service has been removed from Symfony.
It should be migrated to RequestStack->getSession().

**Steps to reproduce** 
Create a controller that use `\Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait` and call short method  `addFlash`

**Possible Solution**  
Posted above

comment.body:
> Note: If you're creating your custom controller, I recommend sending the flash message through the [Notifier](https://symfony.com/doc/current/notifier.html) component, which centralizes absolutely all of your notifications in one place.

Thanks but I don't want to add a (another) huge dependency to a big Symfony component just to send... A flashbag message with 5 words on this. 🙄 
This is far from being optimized in POV.

issue.title: \Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait::addFlash throw error on Sylius 1.12
issue.body:
**Sylius version affected**: 1.12.x

**Description**  
This trait is trowing error since the "session" service has been removed from Symfony.
It should be migrated to RequestStack->getSession().

**Steps to reproduce** 
Create a controller that use `\Sylius\Bundle\ResourceBundle\Controller\ControllerTrait` and call short method  `addFlash`

**Possible Solution**  
Posted above

comment.body: Note: If you're creating your custom controller, I recommend sending the flash message through the [Notifier](https://symfony.com/doc/current/notifier.html) component, which centralizes absolutely all of your notifications in one place.

+ file that was distributed with this source code.

+
+<resources
+    xmlns="https://api-platform.com/schema/metadata/resources-3.0"
+    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+    xsi:schemaLocation="https://api-platform.com/schema/metadata/resources-3.0 https://api-platform.com/schema/metadata/resources-3.0.xsd"
+>
+    <resource class="Sylius\Component\Core\Model\ProductVariant" shortName="ProductVariant">
+        <validationContext>
+            <values>
+                <value name="groups">
+                    <values>
+                        <value>sylius</value>
+                    </values>
+                </value>
+            </values>
+        </validationContext>
+
+        <operations>
+            <operation class="ApiPlatform\Metadata\GetCollection" uriTemplate="/admin/product-variants">
+                <normalizationContext>
+                    <values>
+                        <value name="groups">
+                            <values>
+                                <value>admin:product_variant:read</value>
+                            </values>
+                        </value>
+                    </values>
+                </normalizationContext>
+                <filters>
+                    <filter>Sylius\Bundle\ApiBundle\Filter\Doctrine\ProductVariantCatalogPromotionFilter</filter>
+                </filters>
+            </operation>
+
+            <operation class="ApiPlatform\Metadata\Get" uriTemplate="/shop/product-variants/{code}">

comment.body: The `ProductVariantNormalizer` adds to the `context` variable `self::ALREADY_CALLED => true`, so I need to have `context` that I will pass to the function and one that will be passed to the iriConverter.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,42 @@
+<?php
+
+/*
+ * This file is part of the Sylius package.
+ *
+ * (c) Sylius Sp. z o.o.
+ *
+ * For the full copyright and license information, please view the LICENSE
+ * file that was distributed with this source code.
+ */
+
+declare(strict_types=1);
+
+namespace Sylius\Bundle\ApiBundle\OpenApi\Documentation;
+
+use ApiPlatform\OpenApi\OpenApi;
+
+/** @experimental */
+final class CustomerDocumentationModifier implements DocumentationModifierInterface
+{
+    public function modify(OpenApi $docs): OpenApi
+    {
+        $components = $docs->getComponents();
+        $schemas = $components->getSchemas();
+
+        $schemas['ShopUser.jsonld-admin.customer.create']['properties']['verified'] = [
+            'type' => 'boolean',
+            'default' => false,
+            'example' => false,
+        ];
+
+        $schemas['ShopUser.jsonld-admin.customer.update']['properties']['verified'] = [
+            'type' => 'boolean',
+            'default' => false,
+            'example' => false,
+        ];
+
+        return $docs->withComponents(
+            $components->withSchemas($schemas),
+        );
comment.body: It could be in one line

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,44 +9,51 @@ Feature: Seeing customer's details
         And the store has a customer group Retail
         And the store has customer "f.baggins@shire.me" with name "Frodo Baggins" and phone number "666777888" since "2011-01-10 21:00"
 
-    @ui
+    @ui @api
     Scenario: Seeing customer's basic information
         When I view details of the customer "f.baggins@shire.me"
         Then his name should be "Frodo Baggins"
-        And he should be registered since "2011-01-10 21:00"
+        And he should be registered since "2011-01-10 21:00:00"
         And his email should be "f.baggins@shire.me"
         And his phone number should be "666777888"
 
-    @ui
+    @ui @no-api
     Scenario: Seeing customer's default address
         Given the store operates in "New Zealand"
         And their default address is "Hobbiton", "Bag End", "1", "New Zealand" for "Frodo Baggins"
         When I view details of the customer "f.baggins@shire.me"
         Then his default address should be "Frodo Baggins, Bag End, Hobbiton, NEW ZEALAND 1"
 
-    @ui
+    @api @no-ui
+    Scenario: Seeing customer's default address
+        Given the store operates in "New Zealand"
+        And their default address is "Hobbiton", "Bag End", "1", "New Zealand" for "Frodo Baggins"
+        When I view details of the customer "f.baggins@shire.me"
+        Then his default address should be "Frodo" "Baggins", "Bag End", "1" "Hobbiton", "NZ"
comment.body: I believe that it is possible to have a single scenario for both UI and API contexts, as the difference is  only in last step with data checking
